pageContent: Purpose: Gay men with prostate cancer are an 'invisible species' in the research literature despite concerns that the impact of treatment may be more profound and in some ways unique compared to heterosexual men. The aim of this research is to explore the lived experience of gay men with prostate cancer.

metaData.source:
Prostate cancer chemoprevention: update of the prostate cancer prevention trial findings and implications for clinical practice
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/18928669/
